meaningMnemonic:
When you're all by yourself and only your <kanji>self</kanji> <kanji>exist</kanji>s, you probably have <vocabulary>full control</vocabulary>. You can do whatever you want <vocabulary>freely</vocabulary> and <vocabulary>at will</vocabulary>.

自在 is commonly used with the particle に to form the adverb 自在に. This describes how someone can handle something effortlessly, as if they have full control over it.
readingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji. You should be able to read this on your own.
